Package fractions

Class Fraction

java.lang.Object
fractions.Fraction
public class Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
The Fraction class represents parts of a whole number

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Fraction()
    Initialises a Fraction object to 0
    Fraction​(double numerator)
    Initialises a Fraction object to represent a whole number
    Fraction​(double numerator, double denominator)
    Initialises a Fraction object to represent a proper or improper fraction
    Fraction​(double wholeNumber, double numerator, double denominator)
    Initialises a Fraction object to represent a mixed fraction
    Fraction​(Fraction fraction)
    Initialises a Fraction object to copy another fraction

    Compare two fractions based on their equivalent decimal forms

    Returns the result of the division of the numerator by the denominator

    Returns true or false depending on if the numerator and denominator of the Fraction has a common factor

    Returns the result of the multiplication of two fractions

    Creates a new Fraction from a given Fraction and turns it negative if it was positive and vice versa

    Returns the result of a fraction raised to the power of the specified integer

    Breaks a Fraction numerator and denominator to their smallest forms without a common factor

      public Fraction()
      Initialises a Fraction object to 0

    • Fraction

      public Fraction​(double numerator)
      Initialises a Fraction object to represent a whole number
      Parameters:
      numerator - a whole

    • Fraction

      public Fraction​(double numerator, double denominator) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Initialises a Fraction object to represent a proper or improper fraction
      Parameters:
      numerator - part(s) of a whole
      denominator - a whole
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if the denominator parsed is 0

    • Fraction

      public Fraction​(double wholeNumber, double numerator, double denominator) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Initialises a Fraction object to represent a mixed fraction
      Parameters:
      wholeNumber - the wholes of the fraction
      numerator - the remainder of the wholes of the fraction
      denominator - a whole
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if the denominator parsed is 0

    • Fraction

      public Fraction​(Fraction fraction)
      Initialises a Fraction object to copy another fraction
      Parameters:
      fraction - the Fraction to be copied

  • Method Details

    • simplify

      public void simplify()
      Breaks a Fraction numerator and denominator to their smallest forms without a common factor

    • isSimplified

      public boolean isSimplified()
      Returns true or false depending on if the numerator and denominator of the Fraction has a common factor
      Returns:
      true if the the numerator and denominator of the Fraction have a common factor, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the fraction
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string in the form "numerator / denominator". Special case:
      • If the denominator is equal to 1, only the numerator is returned

    • addFractions

      public static Fraction addFractions​(Fraction firstFraction, Fraction secondFraction) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Returns the result of the addition of two fractions
      Parameters:
      firstFraction - a fraction to be added
      secondFraction - another fraction to be added
      Returns:
      a Fraction that is the result of the addition of two fractions
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if a denominator parsed is 0

    • subtractFractions

      public static Fraction subtractFractions​(Fraction firstFraction, Fraction secondFraction) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Returns the result of the subtraction of two fractions
      Parameters:
      firstFraction - the minuend
      secondFraction - the subtrahend
      Returns:
      a Fraction that is the result of the subtraction of two fractions
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if a denominator parsed is 0

    • multiplyFractions

      public static Fraction multiplyFractions​(Fraction firstFraction, Fraction secondFraction) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Returns the result of the multiplication of two fractions
      Parameters:
      firstFraction - the multiplicand
      secondFraction - the multiplier
      Returns:
      a Fraction that is the result of the multiplication of two fractions
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if a denominator parsed is 0

      public static Fraction divideFractions​(Fraction firstFraction, Fraction secondFraction) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Returns the result of the division of two fractions
      Parameters:
      firstFraction - the dividend
      secondFraction - the divisor
      Returns:
      a Fraction that is the result of the division of two fractions
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if a denominator parsed is 0

    • raiseToPower

      public static Fraction raiseToPower​(Fraction fraction, int power) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Returns the result of a fraction raised to the power of the specified integer
      Parameters:
      fraction - the base
      power - the exponent
      Returns:
      a Fraction that is the result of the fraction raised to the power of the specified integer
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if a denominator parsed is 0

    • negateFraction

      public static Fraction negateFraction​(Fraction fraction)
      Creates a new Fraction from a given Fraction and turns it negative if it was positive and vice versa
      Parameters:
      fraction - a Fraction to copy
      Returns:
      a new Fraction from fraction and turns it negative if it was positive and vice versa

    • toReciprocal

      public static Fraction toReciprocal​(Fraction fraction) throws fractions.DenominatorException
      Creates a new Fraction from a given Fraction and interchanges the numerator and denominator
      Parameters:
      fraction - a Fraction to copy
      Returns:
      a new Fraction from fraction and interchanges the numerator and denominator
      Throws:
      fractions.DenominatorException - if the numerator is 0

    • convertToDecimal

      public double convertToDecimal()
      Returns the result of the division of the numerator by the denominator
      Returns:
      the result of the division of the numerator by the denominator

    • convertToFraction

      public static Fraction convertToFraction​(java.lang.String fractionString) throws java.lang.Exception
      Returns a Fraction object from a string in a Fraction format
      Parameters:
      fractionString - a string in a fraction format: a, b/c or a b/c
      Returns:
      a Fraction object from the fractionString
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if the fractionString is in an invalid format and if 0 is parsed as denominator

    • compareFractions

      public static int compareFractions​(Fraction firstFraction, Fraction secondFraction)
      Compare two fractions based on their equivalent decimal forms
      Parameters:
      firstFraction - main fraction
      secondFraction - compared fraction
      Returns:
      the value 0 if the fractions are equal, a value lesser than 0 if the firstFraction is lesser than the secondFraction and a value greater than 0 if the firstFraction is greater than the secondFraction
